boat.name: Tabnab
boat.full_description:
The current owner reports that when he bought Tabnab, she had been sitting in a boatyard neglected for about 12 years. Most of the cockpit had been ripped out and she had about 6'' of water in her. It would have been more but luckily a skin fitting had been removed which kept the level below the engine (a Volvo MD5A).

Once the boat was sailing it became apparent that her windward abilities were not of the best. John Banton decided to add 6'' to her keel, this work was carried out in 2011, lots of work-never again, transforming the boat so that she now points as well as other similar sized gaffers.
boat.construction_details: grp hull with sheathed ply topsides.
boat.short_description: Gaff cutter built with GRP hull with ply deck and topsides on traditional West Country lines.
